bibentry.bib-extract: Collusion, persistent private information, dynamic games, auctions

bibentry.bib-title: On the markovian efficiency of bertrand and cournot equilibria
bibentry.bib-data: @article{differentialresource, title = {On the Markovian efficiency of Bertrand and Cournot equilibria}, journal = {Journal of Economic Theory}, volume = {155}, number = {}, pages = {332 - 358}, year = {2015}, note = {}, issn = {0022-0531}, doi = {http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.jet.2014.11.007}, url = {http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0022053114001665}, author = {Luca Colombo and Paola Labrecciosa}, keywords = {Closed-Loop Nash Equilibria}, keywords = {Market efficiency}, keywords = {Product differentiation}, keywords = {Productive asset oligopoly}}

bibentry.bib-extract: Recent work in game theory has shown that, in principle, it may be possible for firms in an industry to form a self-policing cartel to maximize their joint profits. This paper examines the nature of cartel self-enforcement in the presence of demand uncertainty. A model of a noncooperatively supported cartel is presented, and the aspects of industry structure which would make such a cartel viable are discussed.
bibentry.bib-title: Noncooperative collusion under imperfect price information
bibentry.bib-data: @article{greenold, issn = {00129682, 14680262}, url = {http://www.jstor.org/stable/1911462}, abstract = {Recent work in game theory has shown that, in principle, it may be possible for firms in an industry to form a self-policing cartel to maximize their joint profits. This paper examines the nature of cartel self-enforcement in the presence of demand uncertainty. A model of a noncooperatively supported cartel is presented, and the aspects of industry structure which would make such a cartel viable are discussed.}, author = {Edward J. Green, Robert H. Porter}, journal = {Econometrica}, number = {1}, pages = {87-100}, publisher = {[Wiley, Econometric Society]}, title = {Noncooperative Collusion under Imperfect Price Information}, volume = {52}, year = {1984}}

@article{generalizedcomm, title = {Communication in Cournot oligopoly}, author = {Goltsman, Maria and Pavlov, Gregory}, journal = {Journal of Economic Theory}, volume = {153}, pages = {152–176}, year = {2014}, publisher = {Elsevier}}

bibentry.bib-extract: This article studies the fulfilled expectations equilibrium for a Cournot duopoly model in which firms acquire information about uncertain linear demand. Several propositions are established concerning the incentives to acquire and release information in this duopoly environment.
bibentry.bib-title: Fulfilled expectations cournot duopoly with information acquisition and release
bibentry.bib-data: @article{shareinfo, issn = {0361915X}, url = {http://www.jstor.org/stable/3003442}, abstract = {This article studies the fulfilled expectations equilibrium for a Cournot duopoly model in which firms acquire information about uncertain linear demand. Several propositions are established concerning the incentives to acquire and release information in this duopoly environment.}, author = {William Novshek, Hugo Sonnenschein}, journal = {The Bell Journal of Economics}, number = {1}, pages = {214-218}, publisher = {[RAND Corporation, Wiley]}, title = {Fulfilled Expectations Cournot Duopoly with Information Acquisition and Release}, volume = {13}, year = {1982}}
